answers.answer: First, let's clarify your medication. Its not 'Metefromen nor Metformane', its Metformin (Glucophage).  Do not adjust your Metformin without first consulting with your doctor.Its good to see you dropped from 34 to 14-16 but the latter is still very high. You need to give a little more time for your body to adjust but at the same time be aware of your nutrition and perform moderate exercise daily. This includes keeping your weight at normal values.Here's a good start http://tinyurl.com/6s9ads - "7 Principles for Good Diabetes Care"

Could you advise if I should start taking higher dosage of tablets or should I give it more time. When I was 1st told of the problem (2 months ago) my reading was around 34 but has stayed at 14-16 for the past three weeks?
